text: Job’s Sixth Speech: A Response to Bildad
Then\f + \fr 19:1 \ft Hebrew “And” \f* Job answered and said,
“⸤How long⸥\f + \fr 19:2 \ft Literally “Until when” \f* will you\f + \fr 19:2 \ft Plural \f* torment me\f + \fr 19:2 \ft Hebrew “my soul,” or “my self” \f*
and crush me with words?
These ten times you\f + \fr 19:3 \ft Plural \f* have disgraced me;
you\f + \fr 19:3 \ft Plural \f* are not ashamed \add that\add* you\f + \fr 19:3 \ft Plural \f* have attacked\f + \fr 19:3 \ft Or “astonished” \f* me.
And what is more, \add if\add* I have truly erred,
my error remains with me.
If indeed you\f + \fr 19:5 \ft Plural \f* must magnify yourselves against me,
and you\f + \fr 19:5 \ft Plural \f* must let my disgrace argue against me,
know then that God has wronged me
and has surrounded me \add with\add* his net.
“Look, I cry out, ‘Violence!’ but\f + \fr 19:7 \ft Or “and” \f* I am not answered;
I cry out, but\f + \fr 19:7 \ft Hebrew “and” \f* there is no justice.
He has walled up my way so that\f + \fr 19:8 \ft Hebrew “and” \f* I cannot pass;
and he has set darkness upon my paths.
He has taken my glory from me,
and he has removed the crown of\f + \fr 19:9 \ft Or “from” \f* my head.
He has broken me down all around, and I am gone.
And he has uprooted my hope like a tree,
and he has kindled his wrath against me,
and ⸤he has counted me as one of his foes⸥.\f + \fr 19:11 \ft Literally “he has counted me for him as his foes” \f*
His troops have come together
and have thrown up their rampart\f + \fr 19:12 \ft Or “siege works”; compare NRSV \f* against me
and have encamped around my tent.
“He has removed my kinsfolk from me,
and my acquaintances have only\f + \fr 19:13 \ft Or “completely” \f* turned aside from me.
My relatives have failed,
and my close friends have forgotten me.
The sojourners in\f + \fr 19:15 \ft Or “of” \f* my house and my slave women count me as a stranger;
I have become a foreigner in their eyes.
I call to my servant, but\f + \fr 19:16 \ft Hebrew “and” \f* he does not answer;
I must ⸤personally⸥\f + \fr 19:16 \ft Literally “with my mouth” \f* plead with him.
My breath is repulsive to my wife,
and I am loathsome to ⸤my own family⸥.\f + \fr 19:17 \ft Literally “to the children of my womb” \f*
Little boys also despise me;
\add when\add* I rise, then\f + \fr 19:18 \ft Hebrew “and” \f* they talk against me.
All ⸤my intimate friends⸥\f + \fr 19:19 \ft Literally “the men of the circle of my confidants” \f* abhor me,
and these \add whom\add* I have loved have turned against me.
My bones\f + \fr 19:20 \ft Collective singular \f* cling to my skin and to my flesh,
and I have escaped by the skin of my teeth.
“Pity me, pity me, you my friends,
for God’s hand has touched me.
Why do you\f + \fr 19:22 \ft Plural \f* pursue me like God?
And are not satisfied with my flesh?
“⸤O that⸥\f + \fr 19:23 \ft Literally “Who then shall give and” \f* my words could be written down!
⸤O that they could be inscribed in a scroll⸥!\f + \fr 19:23 \ft Literally “Who shall give in the scroll and they could be inscribed” \f*
\add That\add* with a pen of iron and \add with\add* lead
they might be engraved on a rock forever!
But\f + \fr 19:25 \ft Hebrew “And” \f* I myself\f + \fr 19:25 \ft Emphatic personal pronoun \f* know \add that\add* my redeemer \add is\add* alive,
and \add at the\add* last he will stand up upon ⸤the earth⸥.\f + \fr 19:25 \ft Literally “dust” \f*
And after my skin has been thus destroyed,
but\f + \fr 19:26 \ft Hebrew “and” \f* from\f + \fr 19:26 \ft Or “without” \f* my flesh I will see God,
whom ⸤I will see for myself⸥,\f + \fr 19:27 \ft Literally “I myself will see for myself”; emphatic personal pronoun as subject to the singular verb \f*
and \add whom\add* my eyes will see and not a stranger.\f + \fr 19:27 \ft Or “another” \f*
⸤My heart faints within me⸥.\f + \fr 19:27 \ft Literally “My kidneys fail in my lap”; see NRSV \f*
“If you\f + \fr 19:28 \ft Plural \f* say, ‘How will we persecute him?’
And ‘The root of the trouble is found’ in me,\f + \fr 19:28 \ft Or “ ‘The root of the trouble is found’ in him” \f*
be afraid for yourselves ⸤because of the sword⸥,\f + \fr 19:29 \ft Literally “from the faces of \fq the \ft sword” \f*
for wrath \add brings\add* punishment by\f + \fr 19:29 \ft Literally “of” \f* \add the\add* sword,
so that you may know that \add there is\add* judgment.”
